meanings.sent1: I will resend the email to make sure you receive it.
meanings.sent2: Please resend the package if it doesn't arrive on time.
meanings.sent3: He had to resend the invitation because he forgot to attach the file.
meanings.sent4: The echo seemed to resend his words back to him in the empty room.
meanings.sent5: She decided to resend the letter with a more urgent tone this time.

meanings.definition: To forward a message or communication to someone again.
meanings.sent1: Could you resend the text message to my other phone, please?
meanings.sent2: I had to resend the document to my boss after making some corrections.
meanings.sent3: He had to resend the joke to his friend because they missed it the first time.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor had to resend the breaking news to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent5: She quickly hit the resend button to make sure the message went through.
